posts.post_content: [Lightmine Field](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightmine Field). Make them all attack and die. Then, you have three options. Attack with him alone, attack with other creatures as well if they can take the heat, or get rid of your mines and attack with everything!

posts.post_content:
Dear.  
Freaking.  
God.  
  
So unbelievably good.  
  
This card simultaneously appeals to everyone.  
  
Aggro: Your alpha swing next turn is guaranteed, as they have no blockers.  
Control: You have a wrath-proof undamageable 6/6.  
Combo: Their next alpha swing is moot.

posts.post_content:
I don't see how it's all that great. But then again I run every color but white...  
But at the same time, my friend played this against me 3 games in a row and I still won with ease, dragons w/ sarkhan the mad and doubling season w/ some other typical jund and a lil' grixis for ol' bolas.  
  
First time when he forced an attack my dragons killed it then I dropped a voracious dragon consumed some arsonist killed his best guy and had big defender  
  
Second time he attacked w/ the 0 and I terminated as any jund would  
  
third time he tried to kill my tapped hellkite overlord... Regenerated, dropped a bolas and killed for +3  
  
played a few other times against me but those are the most notable examples.   
  
Not trying to brag just saying he's easy to kill, besides w/ eldrazi annihalator all attacking doesn't seem like a good idea, not to mention suicidal charge does the same thing but better.   
  
EDIT: although this does work well with lightmine field, what about vigilance? Alot easier to come by.  
Also... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: @WhiteyMcFly: And how can he do it? Which of his three abilities let you win in the same turn he enters the battlefield? Force to attack -> next turn. [\*\*\*\*\*\*inate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=******inate) (or [Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengeance)) can't destroy a blocker. And when he turns into a creature, he's affected by summoning sickness. So, he doesn't let you win in the same turn, but the turn later, as Garruk.
